entry.title: Speculation Rules: Add more granular UseCounter for some features.
entry.content:
Log use counters for the following cases:

* a prefetch (presumably from speculation rules) attempt starts

* a rule set including rules for "prefetch" or "prerender" is added

(split by whether it was added by the author or by browser injection)

entry.title: [iOS] Refactor formInputAccessoryView getter method
entry.content:
Remove the getter method of formInputAccessoryView to avoid getting the

view by casting from `self.view`, which will trigger `-(void)loadView`

to create the view immediately. Instead, use a property to save the

view.

This CL is a preparation to improve startup letancy by lazily loading

the form input accessory view when it's used.



Bug: 1515588

entry.title: Create Android Anchor Manager
entry.content:
Prototype the anchors extension on Android. Note that one struct was

missing from the original `dev` drop of xr_android that is now added.



This also changes the return type of `GetAnchorFromMojom` to allow

returning multiple types of errors. This is used in case the Android

API reports that it has stopped tracking an Anchor as a hint that we

should remove the anchor from consideration for future processing.

This matches what we do in the ArCoreAnchorManager as well as what

the spec allows.



Bug: 1435548

Change-Id: I8b1268a5e99066fd614391dc555d4ba8b774bb25

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5253988

Reviewed-by: Piotr Bialecki

Commit-Queue: Alexander Cooper

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1254880}

entry.title: Refactor Msft specific logic out of AnchorManager
entry.content:
Splits OpenXrAnchorManager into a base class (OpenXrAnchorManager) and

OpenXrAnchorManagerMsft in preparation for prototyping Anchors on

Android. Also cleans up a few headers and converts a few absl::optional

types to std::optionals. Note that this resulted in some missing

includes appearing in other files that needed to be updated.



Note that this class will be moving into the corresponding

SceneUnderstandingManagers during the implementation of planes and

plane based anchors, but that was not needed for purely spatial anchors.



Bug: 1435548

Change-Id: Iadfd907bec966d62f416687c565c393f7dfdbb00

entry.title: [Office] More fine-grained UMAs for invalid alternate URLs
entry.content:
Split OfficeDriveOpenErrors::kInvalidAlternateUrl into

- kWaitingForUpload (empty URL because the file is not uploaded yet)

- kEmptyAlternateUrl (empty URL resulting from another error)

- kInvalidAlternateUrl



Checks in `OpenDriveUrl` were redundant for the "upload to drive and

open" flow, since the alternate URL is already checked by the

DriveUploadHandler. Checks are removed from this method.



Bug: b:314878268

entry.title: [iOS] Avoid forcing layout location bar for unanimated expand/contract
entry.content:
Expand/contract location bar will force layout immediately with a call

to `layoutIfNeeded`, but the layout is not necessary at startup. The

layout adds ~25ms to the startup latency on the iPhone 7 (according to

Instruments).

This CL avoids forcing layout location bar for unanimated

expand/contract to reduce unnecessary costs at startup.



Instruments measurements:

https://docs.google.com/document/d/1gyVFWPn2WDPIyi5zY1WFUjhsL2Z26RsUyHLNw87lIWE/edit?usp=sharing



Bug: 1515588

entry.title: exo: HitTestMask on widget space, not the host window
entry.content:
GetWidgetHitTestMask should pass the mask on the widget coordinate space

but the existing implementation returns the mask on the host window

coordinate space.

The bug was exposed by out-of-window clip delegation since it

introduces the case where the origin becomes negative.

entry.title: Revert "TaskAttribution: Refactor regexp script context and use for CPED"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 611b5a084486cd6d99a0dad63f34e320a2ebc2b3.



Reason for revert: The change is causing some v8 memory regressions due

to the additional Context. Since this isn't strictly needed to fix

crbug.com/1499822, and since the number of pages the Context is created

on for regexp probably isn't high enough to justify the regression,

we'll revert to using the provided ScriptState. There may be some other

options we can pursue for removing the dependence on ScriptState.



Original change's description:



> TaskAttribution: Refactor regexp script context and use for CPED

>

> This is part of changing continuation preserved embedder data (CPED) to

> be per-isolate instead of per-context. This CL:

> - Change V8PerIsolateData::EnsureScriptRegexpScriptState() to return

> ScriptState, which simplifies the rest.

>

> - Adds V8PerIsolateData::

> EnsureContinuationPreservedEmbedderDataScriptState(). This

> returns the same ScriptState as the EnsureScriptRegexpScriptState()

> to reduce overhead (implementation detail).

>

> - Renames WorldType::kRegExp to kBlinkInternalNonJSExposed, which is

> the type used for the shared CPED/RegExp context.



> - Uses the internal non-js exposed utility context to set the CPED for

task attribution and scheduling APIs.

entry.title: Revert "Add CHECK to AXPlatformNodeWin::InternalRelease to detect double-free"
entry.content:
This reverts commit 3186a0be55861e06ba8d8b89f4dd9ddadb829a27.



Reason for revert: This is not needed anymore as we have fixed the real issue in CL:5214694



Original change's description:

> Add CHECK to AXPlatformNodeWin::InternalRelease to detect double-free

>

> This CL adds a CHECK in AXPlatformNodeWin::InternalRelease that tests

> whether the instance's memory can be freed from an external COM client. I think that it's possible in theory, but would like to see

> some crashes in the wild to confirm it.

>

> The theory is this:

> 1. An AXFragmentRootPlatformNodeWin ComPtr is created upon creation of

> an AXFragmentRootWin (the member `platform_node_`). At that point, the

> refcount is 1.

> 2. A COM client, presumably an assistive technology, gets a reference

> to that ComPtr. The refcount at this point is 2.

> 3. The COM client releases the ComPtr more than once, mistakenly,

> freeing the memory associated with this ComPtr. (refcount = 0)

> 4. Since `platform_node_` only gets nullified (ie., = nullptr) when

> the AXFragmentRootWin is destroyed, the `platform_node_` is not nullptr

> at line 5051 in AXPlatformNodeWin::Navigate, so we get into the `if`.

> 5. At line 5060, we try to access the memory in the pointer that got

> freed and it crashes.

>

> This CL introduces a new member `destroy_was_called_` only set to true

> when AXPlatformNodeWin::Destroy (and therefore the subclass

> AXFragmentRootPlatformNodeWin) is called. We set it before the ComPtr

> is released again (see `Dispose`), so the CHECK should always pass if

> the refcount only reaches 0 after the internal reference to the

> platform node is nullified.

>

>

> Bug: 1456463

> Change-Id: I4aed6dd7d8d690a46e550619606dade06b3450f3

> Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5121179

> Commit-Queue: Benjamin Beaudry

> Auto-Submit: Benjamin Beaudry

> Reviewed-by: Greg Thompson

> Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1237550}



Bug: 1456463

Change-Id: I83774e3a1ed531f53ebfe587c650667abebb7f60

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5253046

entry.content:

on the server-side, this CL adds a new boolean field is_async_check in

SafeBrowsingClientProperties. Chrome will set this field for both

interstitial and warning shown CSBRRs. This info is useful in

check affects the warnings bypass rate.

entry.title: Add web setting for disabling scrollbar styles
entry.content:
This change is part 2 of a 4-part series of changes to implement logic

for disabling custom scrollbar styling based on user preference. Custom

scrollbar styling can be problematic for accessibility when colors with

low contrast are used or the scrollbar width is too small.



The changes in this CL register the web preference and add the web

setting that can be used to implement logic to disable ::webkit prefixed

scrollbar pseudo elements as well as CSS ScrollbarColor and

ScrollbarWidth properties, based on user preference.



A subsequent change will include the logic to disable the styling, gated

behind the web preference. There will not be UI added to actually allow

a user to control that preference, but that would be a future change.

entry.title: TrayBubble: bubbles not updating correctly on tablet state change
entry.content:
Currently, when transitioning between tablet and clamshell mode, the

tray bubble views don't update their position. This leads to weird

states such as incorrect padding, floating in the middle of the screen,

and overlapping the shelf. This is due to the bubble view anchor and

insets not being updated.



This CL will make it so that the tray bubble view will update its anchor

and insets whenever transitioning between tablet and clamshell mode, as

well as also reacting to shelf alignment changes.

> Implementing uncompressed chrome installer

>

> `--resource_file_path_uncompressed`.

> target is defined for non-debug builds when the

entry.title: [a11y] NextOnLine/PrevOnLine computation on aria-hidden nodes
entry.content:
Currently, there is a bug with the following tree structure:





first line


thisis broken.

last line






We compute "this" NextOnLine to be "is" even though it is

ignored/invisible. This logically makes no sense, since the node

is invisible so it shouldn't be another node's Next/PrevOnLine.

This also caused an issue with NVDA when navigating by line.



It would not announce the whole line when navigating to the second

line in the example, instead stopping right before the ignore node.



This was because the behavior explained above and the fact that

Next/PrevOnLine are only computed for unignored nodes, so essentially

we were taking "is" as the start of a new line since it had no

PrevOnLineId attribute set on it.



To fix the bug we added a check for if the anchor of the position

is ignored, and also made it so during the Next/PrevOnLine computation

we set it to the next non-ignored node.



Change-Id: I4113b9357fc3b762b99554f8ce16e4a70498264d

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5247179

Reviewed-by: Benjamin Beaudry

Commit-Queue: Benjamin Beaudry

Reviewed-by: Aaron Leventhal

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1254831}

entry.title: OP: Have Pinned Notifications exist in their own container view
entry.content:
https://screenshot.googleplex.com/8D58HzTgvNN5wPG



Handle `MessageCenterObserver` logic, which involves creating, removing,

and updating `MessageView` objects, to manage pinned notifications fully

from the `NotificationCenterController` when the `OngoingProcesses` flag

is enabled.



Pinned notifications are cached in a `pinned_notifications_list_view_`,

which is managed and tracked directly by the controller. This container

view does not have special behaviors other than having a layout manager.



Notifications internal logic is still being kept inside of the

`NotificationListView` class to handle unpinned notifications, or pinned

notifications when `OngoingProcesses` is not enabled.



TODO(b/322835713): In following CLs unpinned notifications and their

list view should also be managed by the `NotificationCenterController`.



Tests will be parameterized to test with the `OngoingProcesses` feature

flag enabled once the new `PinnedNotificationView` is implemented to

have a more accurate finished production behavior.



Bug: b:293470170, b:321751530

entry.title: [Win-a11y] Fix accessibility hit testing on Views with multiple monitors
entry.content:
On a multi-monitor setup where the monitors have different resolutions,

the accessible hit testing APIs are not returning the right value on

Windows for Views. This was because we were not converting the

coordinates into the right coordinates space.



We need to convert the points received by the Windows APIs from Windows

relative physical points to our own internal adjusted representation

of the screen point. A more thorough explanation can be found in the

commit description of CL:5239465.



Fixed: 1521966

entry.title: Multiplanar: Adjust for 16 bit format multipliers in VRU
entry.content:
A previous change that remove HalfFloatMaker [1] also removed

multipliers set for 16 bit formats. These multipliers are used for

bit shifting with 16 bit formats which have 10 bit data and where 6

most significant bits are 0s. This change adjusts for it using

ConvertToMSBPlane_16 which moves the 0s to least significant bits.



[1] https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5234521

entry.title: Use recorded bounds instead of layer bounds for tiling
entry.content:
The changed behavior is behind feature

"UseRecordedBoundsForTiling". When it's enabled, for applicable

picture layers, we'll use `DisplayItemList::bounds()` instead of the

layer bounds as the tiling rect of the tilings. This may reduce the

total number of tiles containing rasterizable contents, thus reduce

the cost of rasterization.



The changes at the impl side are not behind the flag, but the changes

apply only if the feature is enabled. Otherwise the recorded bounds

are the same as the layer bounds.



Bug: 1517714

entry.title: WebNN: CoreML Initial backend standup
entry.content:
This change implements a coreml backend for webnn, supporting just one

operator 'Add' to begin with.



Following sample code can run on a mac with this cl applied.



const operandType = {type: 'float32',

dataType: 'float32', dimensions: [2, 2]};

const context = await navigator.ml.createContext(

{'deviceType' : 'gpu'});

const builder = new MLGraphBuilder(context);

// 1. Create a computational graph 'C = A + B'.

const A = builder.input('A', operandType);

const B = builder.input('B', operandType);

const C = builder.add(A, B);

// 2. Build the graph into an executable.

const graph = await builder.build({'C': C});

// 3. Bind inputs to the graph and execute for the result.

const bufferA = new Float32Array(4).fill(1.0);

const bufferB = new Float32Array(4).fill(0.8);

const bufferC = new Float32Array(4);

const inputs = {'A': bufferA, 'B': bufferB};

const outputs = {'C': bufferC};

const results = await context.compute(graph,

inputs, outputs);

console.log('Output value: ' + results.outputs.C);





Change-Id: I452b8786cdc7574985b426959d24d76d3f6a2f9f

Bug: 1508712

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5075312

entry.title: Fix dangling pointer in InkDropHostTest
entry.content:
InkDropHostTest embeds TestViewWithInkDrop which caches a pointer to an

InkDrop created as part of a test's call to test_api_.GetInkDrop. Later

calls to test_api_.SetInkDropMode can delete that InkDrop and leave the

pointer on TestViewWithInkDrop dangling. This pattern happens in one of

the InkDropHostTest tests due to a for loop that iterates through the

different InkDropMode.



This change fixes the issue for this test by explicitly clearing the

cached pointer each time the test loop is executed.



Change-Id: Idaa724e3d05326a3bcaa1017390245db18a18ca5

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5254542

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Move logic for checking for max text length back to WebUI.
entry.content:
The max text length checks are in place due to crbug.com/1176078.



Even though this does introduce back in some substrings being passed

between WebUI and C++, I think this approach is preferable to the

current approach because:

1.) The bug is a speech synthesis bug in TypeScript, so to me, it makes

most sense for the bug's workaround to be in TypeScript instead of

C++. The C++ code is looking for the accessible sentence boundaries

and shouldn't be concerned with what the maximum length supported

by various TTS engines is.

2.) When the workaround was in C++, it unnecessarily impacted what's

highlighted. Addressing in TypeScript allows us to highlight the

correct segment, regardless of whether it's over the speech limit.

This means highlighting a complete sentence rather than arbitrarily

splicing a sentence's highlight.

3.) #getAccessibleTextLength should be called fairly infrequently in

this CL as-is. It will only be called when a sentence is longer

than 175 characters, which does happen, but the majority of

sentences that I've come across while testing are shorter than this.

4.) Additional checks such as as check for whether we're using a remote

voice will completely remove calls to #getAccessibleTextBoundary for

many voices (such as those on ChromeOS)

5.) This also makes it easier for us to properly handle official

speech synthesis text-too-long errors received via callback in

TypeScript.



Bug: 1474951

Change-Id: Ibd4f7055ffaab4825689b2b1b724a09766bf2572

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5241650

Commit-Queue: Lauren Winston

Reviewed-by: Abigail Klein

Cr-Commit-Position: refs/heads/main@{#1254780}

entry.title: [Extensions] Change runtime.getContexts() CHECK to DCHECK.
entry.content:
This CHECK is causing browser crashes due to an unlikely scenario being

increasing hit in some platforms/builds. The scenario is that:



1) multiple active service workers registered for an extension

(there should be only one - crbug.com/1493391), and

2) the extension calls chrome.runtime.getContexts() without a filter

or with a filter for ContextType BACKGROUND

3)the extension uses a service worker (always true since

getContexts() is MV3+ only)





After this change we will no longer crash the browser, but could return

incorrect background context information temporarily when #1 occurs

above. See crbug.com/1521080#c9 for more details.



Fixed: 1521080

Change-Id: I4a851b5d2c5576ca8150ce397f6442b47cad3243

entry.title: Disable overdraw optimization inside layers
entry.content:
To implement overdraw inside layers, we would need to drop paint ops

inside the current layer only, without touching the paint ops in parent

layers. The current overdraw optimization logic can't do this however,

it would drop paint ops of all parent layers, which is not correct.

entry.title: Correct onstart event order for MediaRecorder of mp4 muxer.
entry.content:
The onstart event of MediaRecorder should be triggered when

data is first written by the addition of a frame. However, the current

code only flushes the data during a timeout or at the end of recording,

causing the onstart event to be fired late.



To fix this issue, the static data of the ftyp box should be written

as soon as the incoming frame is written to the internal cache.



Bug: 1520136

Change-Id: Ief9d67b7759fc50a18ccc3638f6825a8d47f71ee

entry.title: Replace .com/.org/.gov in a pair of auction_worklet test fixtures.
entry.content:
In particular, in bidder_worklet.cc and seller_worklet.cc, replace

example.com with example.test and example.org with example2.test, since

example.com is more prevalent.



Also did a pass swapping "example2.test" and "example.test" where

example2 ended up being used first, or where example2 was being used

unnecessarily, and updating a couple other origins that were used

less often.



The motivation for this change is that tests should generally use

*.test domain names, to avoid accidentally depending on real domains.

*.test is reserved, so should never match a "real" domain name.

(e.g., if a DNS lookup ever makes it to a public DNS server, we could

accidentally depend on the existence, or even the response of, a

real server on the web, which tests shouldn't be depending on. It could

even result in a security vulnerability in the test bots, in theory).



Bug: None

Change-Id: I5c4a79e5ab6146566b73b21ee7947dba52c0c6a7

Reviewed-on: https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/5253741

entry.title: views: don't clip modal dialog to its parent
entry.content:
The modal dialog was clipped to its host's boundary. This caused problem

in mac immersive fullscreen because the host is dedicated to the tab

strip and as such the dialog is clipped to the tab strip area.



This CL keeps modal dialog's original size. The clipping logic was

adding in crbug.com/1341530. I manually tested the bug and can confirm

that this change does not resurrect that bug.



Bug: 1521451

entry.title: Implement :state(foo) alongside :--foo
entry.content:
This patch implements :state(foo) alongsite :--foo so that we can have

both supported on stable at the same time and then deprecate/remove

:--foo. This patch does not enable :state(foo) by default. I will do

that after implementing deprecation for :--foo.



Due to pushback from webkit, the syntax for this feature was discussed

again in the CSSWG, and a resolution was made to go back from :--foo to

:state(foo):

https://github.com/w3c/csswg-drafts/issues/4805#issuecomment-1663111980



This was discussed in an I2S where we decided to only deprecate :--foo

if WebKit ships :--foo, which has now happened.

https://groups.google.com/a/chromium.org/g/blink-dev/c/JvpHoUfhJYE



Fixed: 1508033

entry.title: [Nearby Presence] Create PresenceDevice map to keep pointers in scope
entry.content:
Because |Core| takes in a `const PresenceDevice&`, it does not maintain

its own copy of PresenceDevice. Once the PresenceDevice goes out of

scope, referencing it in Core will cause a segfault. This change instead

uses a `PresenceDevice*` flat_map so Core won't be holding invalid

references when these functions go out of scope.



Test: this is an implementation detail, so no unit tests were added as

this is not part of the NC interface.



Fixed: b/315016880

Change-Id: I380ee6961468181f07b395d5a9a37f54fe1b4449

entry.title: Make MergeFullSyncData() call through (almost) directly to ApplyIncrementalSyncChanges().
entry.content:
This removes a bunch of complexity with trying to merge

data from the Installed apps on the device, the Registry,

and Sync, and instead just takes data from Sync and applies

it directly to the Registry, like in the incremental case.



This means that WebAPKs installed before Sync was enabled

will not get backed up until they're launched again

post-Sync-enable.



This basically undoes all of https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Pce17EEuIs0dIbw-L1RZVf2HA4H8-Lu8RqVxHGmdJds.



Note (in case it makes it easier to review) that the logic

from PrepareRegistryUpdateFromInstalledAndSyncApps() mostly

got split up between SyncDataContainsNewApps() and

PrepareRegistryUpdateFromSyncApps().



Bug: 1519196

entry.title: Test HeapProfilerIncludeZero for all reports
entry.content:
This makes HeapProfilerController test the HeapProfilerIncludeZero

feature whenever uploading a report, so that users can be sorted into

equally-sized groups.



With this change we can enable HeapProfilerIncludeZero for 50% of users

in M123 and 100% of users in M124. Then we can compare reports pre and

post M123 as follows:



* When comparing pre-M123 reports to M123, search for reports with

HeapProfilerIncludeZero disabled. (This will include all users before

the HeapProfilerIncludeZero feature landed in 123.0.6264.0.)

* When comparing M123 reports to post-M123, search for reports with

HeapProfilerIncludeZero enabled.



There will be a small anomaly on canary from 123.0.6264.0 to

123.0.6272.0, where HeapProfilerIncludeZero is enabled only for reports

that have 0 samples.



R=etienneb



Bug: 1327069

entry.title: [Read Aloud] Fix crash when reading on Spanish page.
entry.content:
The value returned by GetNextSentence can occasionally be less than

the current text length when looking at combined sentences when

a sentence is close to the maximum text length. When this happens,

we shouldn't attempt to add any text from the next node to our

current utterance.



This will likely be an obsolete change after crrev.com/c/5241650, but

since that is a larger change, I figured it was better to submit

a simple fix for the crash, since this is what by the code should

be doing anyways.



Bug: 1474951

entry.title: Make one less allocation in ConvertJavaStringToUtf(8|16)
entry.content:
Instead of calling JniEnv->GetStringChars to get a heap allocated

string, for small strings, we can allocate a buffer on the stack and

use GetStringRegion to just copy it. We end up with -1 allocation in the

fast path and it should be equivalent in performance (modulo the

allocation).



https://developer.android.com/training/articles/perf-jni#utf-8-and-utf-16-strings:~:text=stack%2Dallocated%20buffer



Bug: 1485798

entry.title: Fix racy iterator use in Node::AddConnection
entry.content:
Before this fix an iterator to `connections_` which requires a lock

would be dereferenced outside an unlock operation because the `it` taken

from the map isn't understood as guarded by the same lock.



This takes a Ref before unlocking which'll keep the link

reference alive even if `connections_` is concurrently modified and the

entry removed (or replaced).



Bug: 1523704

entry.title: Refactor MenuControllerCocoaDelegateImpl.
entry.content:
In preparation of adding remote cocoa support to context menus,

this moves MenuControllerCocoaDelegateImpl to remote_cocoa code,

refactoring it to remove its views dependencies. Rather everything

this class used to get from views (fonts, colors and sizes) is stored

in a (mojom) struct, which is then passed to the delegate.



Using a mojom struct because in a follow up to actually add remote

cocoa support this will need to be passed from the browser process

to the app shim process.



To pass a font over mojom, this adds mac specific mojom serialization

for gfx::Font.



Also removes the now no longer used ColorProvider parameter from

MenuControllerCocoa.



Bug: 1488965

entry.title: [RQ] Always filter out SRP urls from the MV sites
entry.content:
Currently max 1 SRP url can show up in the MV sites if the SRP segment

(e.g., http://google.com/search) makes it way into the segments table

(e.g., via bookmark click). This causes the latest search to always show

up in the MV sites if the accumulated visit count of that segment is

high enough. This is not a good experience and has been causing a lot of

confusion.



SRP URLs are filtered out from the MV sites when the Repeatable Queries

are enabled which is the case on Android only. This CL always filters

out those sites, whether or not Repeatable Queries are enabled.



Bug: 1317829

entry.title: Remove PaymentInstrument inheritance
entry.content:
As discussed in the doc here: http://shortn/_e9T3oASGQN, it is

preferable to use variant instead of inheritance so that we don't have

to pass around ptrs and can instead pass by value. This CL is removing

the inheritance for payment instrument and instead keeping payment

instrument as a member field in bank account class.



Also using DenseSet instead of std::set for the PaymentRail enum.
